snippet: As he celebrated a Mass in St. Peter’s Basilica’s grottoes, New York’s archbishop, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, said the daily life of the church was more important than choosing a new pope.
abstract: Cardinal Timothy M Dolan, New York's archbishop, says daily life of Catholic Church is more important than picking Pope Benedict XVI's successor; Dolan celebrates Mass in St Peter's Basilica's grottoes in Rome, where he is to participate in conversations for electing a new pope.
lead_paragraph: As he celebrated a Mass in St. Peter’s Basilica’s grottoes, New York’s archbishop, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, said the daily life of the church was more important than choosing a new pope.

headline.seo: In Vatican, Cardinal Dolan Urges Catholics to Look Beyond the Conclave
headline.main: Saying Mass at Vatican, Dolan Urges Catholics to Look Beyond the Papal Conclave
headline.print_headline: Saying Mass at Vatican, Dolan Urges Catholics to Look Beyond the Papal Conclave
